posts.title: New COVID variant NB.1.8.1 behind surge in China, now detected in U.S.
top_comments: Covid starting to look like patch notes
If Nintendo reveals AC for the Switch 2, then it's time to panic.
I'm starting to get sick of reality's recycled plot devices.

[https://cdn.who.int/media/docs/default-source/documents/epp/tracking-sars-cov-2/23052025\_nb.1.8.1\_ire.pdf?sfvrsn=7b14df58\_4](https://cdn.who.int/media/docs/default-source/documents/epp/tracking-sars-cov-2/23052025_nb.1.8.1_ire.pdf?sfvrsn=7b14df58_4)

WHO TAG-VE Risk Evaluation for SARS-CoV-2 Variant Under Monitoring: NB.1.8.1

Executive Summary

NB.1.8.1 has been designated a SARS-CoV-2 variant under monitoring (VUM) with increasing proportions

globally, while LP.8.1 is starting to decline. Considering the available evidence, the additional public health risk

posed by NB.1.8.1 is evaluated as low at the global level. Currently approved COVID-19 vaccines are expected

to remain effective to this variant against symptomatic and severe disease. Despite a concurrent increase in

cases and hospitalizations in some countries where NB.1.8.1 is widespread, current data do not indicate that

this variant leads to more severe illness than other variants in circulation.
Oh good, just in time for it to be against the law for most of us to get vaccinated against it.

Here we go again...

So glad we have the brainworm to keep us strong and healthy.

/s
Trump and Covid, name a more iconic duo....
Maybe another pandemic is what we need to reset the timelines. It'll take us back to 2019 when the world wasn't on fire all the time

And meanwhile in the US....

>While authorities in Hong Kong say there is no evidence that the variant, a descendant of the XDV lineage of the virus, is more severe, they have begun urging residents to mask when in public transportation or crowded places as cases have climbed.

>Health authorities in Taiwan have also reported a rise in emergency room visits, severe cases and deaths. Local health authorities say they are stockpiling vaccines and antiviral treatments in response to the epidemic wave.
Oh goody, better cram everyone back in the office to prop up the real estate holdings of all the billionaires causing these problems. Thanks Blackrock and Vanguard!

posts.title: Killer whales left trapped in abandoned French marine park four months after closure.
top_comments:
Several sanctuaries have petitioned France to rescue the orcas. So far two, one in Japan and one in Canada, have been rejected for being too far to transport. There are also dolphins in another enclosure that need help too. They can not be released due to being bred in captivity.

**Edit:** Courtesy of /u/MtnMoonMama here is a link to write President Macron about the situation if you feel so inclined. https://www.elysee.fr/en/contact/
So they’re feeding them but can’t seem to find the resources to clean the enclosures? Sounds like rubbish excuses from those responsible.

Fucking Christ, that drone shot of them being in separate pools, is just fucking heart breaking. They've been like that for MONTHS! Fucking hell. The previous owners of that abandoned park need to be in jail for decades.

You can send Emmanuel Macron a direct message here


https://www.elysee.fr/en/contact/


Edit: fill out the form. Send it. They send you an email with a link you must click. Click the link to send.

This an intelligent animal that is huge and made for a life in the open ocean.

It must drive them absolutely fucking insane being confined to a limited space
Need to find a maladjusted orphan boy with a soft heart to solve this one.
is it the price of long distance travel that is the problem? i can't imagine the stress of that trip would be more than what they are going through now
Man, where's the Mexican space program when you need it.
Keeping these animals who travel thousands of miles in the wild in little kiddie pools is straight up torture. Idk why we still allow this
what the fucking shit, France?

With her stature as future Queen, the Yales and Stanfords will be eager to offer her a spot. I have more sympathy for the normal people who got in purely on merit — they're the ones truly screwed.

Not calling her crown princess is weird.

im sorry, but what about university autonomy? how the fuck is this happening? what the fuck is wrong with the usa? baffling. absolutely baffling

posts.title: Kim Jong Un watches as North Korea's newest warship falls off dry dock
top_comments:
>The 5,000-ton destroyer slid off a flatcar because of “inexperienced command and operational carelessness in the course of the launch,” according to the Korean Central News Agency, crushing parts of the bottom of the ship.

I wonder if those guys are already dead.

Kinda amusing until you realise a bunch of, most probably innocent, people are going to suffer for this, and that most of N.Korea's population is already horribly suffering, and they're spending their  money on pointless warships.

North Korea doesn't have a dedicated Dry Dock. North Korea has been side launching their ships and does not have a dedicated Dry Dock to do the extensive repairs the ship will need if it could be repaired at all.
Multiple people will get executed for this
Those responsible will be subject to anti-aircraft missiles.
I want to giggle, but I realize someone will pay dearly for this...

This is the entirely predictable outcome of attempting to modernize a navy under Russian tutelage.

https://www.twz.com/russias-cursed-carrier-is-finally-in-a-drydock-that-cant-sink

http://www.hisutton.com/Russian-Floating-Dock-PD-19-Sinks.html

Satellite image of the fallen warship:

https://i.imgur.com/9Mdrqzc.png

They were side-launching the ship and it seems like one end slid while the other lagged behind or remained stationary, causing the whole thing to go caddywompus.
Too bad he doesn't have a butt-hole, then at least he could give a shit.
OMG. In NK they not only punish the perp but their family as well

posts.title: Justice Department reaches deal to allow Boeing to avoid prosecution over 737 Max crashes | AP News

2025 America: corporate crime is now legal and we're done pretending

"The Justice Department said in a court filing that it had reached an “agreement in principle” that will require the company to pay and invest more than $1.1 billion. In return, the department will dismiss the criminal case against the aircraft manufacturer. The deal still needs to be finalized." How much did they give Trump and his family?
DOJ being compromised like this is INSANE.
The “Justice” department

I'm a lawyer, and I'm no spring chicken on how the world works. Even so, I'm never any less disgusted and shocked that murder in this country is legal if you do it from a conference room. 


Boeing murdered 346 people for a marketing strategy.
Justice in Murica.  Bribe the Comrade Cheeto and walk away.

>The Justice Department said in a court filing that it had reached an “agreement in principle” that will require the company to pay and invest more than $1.1 billion. In return, the department will dismiss the criminal case against the aircraft manufacturer.

posts.title: U.S. citizen with REAL ID handcuffed and held in immigration raid before being released
top_comments: Republicans claim that ID is needed to prevent fraud, but when given ID they ignore it because the skin is brown.  They are racists, full stop.
Surprised they released him.

Any idiot can see that this will happen regularly and some citizens will probably end up in El Salvador doing hard time before someone figures out that they don't belong there. Hate is running our country right now and there are a ton of church going MAGA members who applaud it.

>REAL ID is the identification U.S. citizens are required by law to have in order to travel through airports **and enter federal buildings**.

I checked and for certain federal facilities this is true. That is an amazing restriction on the average citizen. I am astonished that this is the law.
Why are we paying for Real ID when they call it fake, are they fucking stupid or something? Why make any of us do any of this when it doesn't matter to them to begin with?

“She said they have been trying to find a lawyer but local ones have told them that it is nearly impossible to sue a federal agent” 

Theres your problem right there. This really should not be a thing. All law enforcement including federal officers should be personally liable whenever they abuse their authority. I really hope when this Trump nightmare is over this is something that will be looked at. Fuck you and your thin blue line
Amerikkka with full Nazi on board. In just a few months Democracy crumbled beneath our feet.

posts.title: Harvard sues Trump administration over move to bar international students
top_comments: Even if Harvard wins decisively in court what international student would risk getting grabbed by ICE and sent to some foreign gulag? That is the true authoritarian evil of this administration. It doesn’t even matter if it would be legal or not. Trump has targeted international students at Harvard and that’s that.
Trump's vendetta against Harvard is deeply disturbing
That was quick. Best of luck to potentially the best legal team in the history of humanity. Their fight depends on legitimacy of the courts, though, so, you know...
The other Ivy League schools need to join in on this and show solidarity…
When America votes in a convicted felon and psychopath as POTUS, don’t be surprised when he does nonstop crazy things.
Nothing to worry folks, the brightest minds that are coming from all parts of the globe to Harvard and other prestigious universities are going to be replaced with the Andrew Tates of the world.
Did Havard reject Baron or something?

“Trump administration’s Joint Task Force to Combat Antisemitism criticized the university for anti-Israel bias. On April 11, the task force sent a letter demanding that Harvard comply with a list of demands that ranged from hiring an outside monitor **to police the ideology of professors and students**.”

What the living fuck? So Trump wants to create a branch of government called the ‘ideology police’? This is as bad as the morality police in Iran.
Trumps fake emergency is getting a lot of mileage.

Trump throwing darts at the board.  Flooding the zone so his funding bill doesn't get extra scrutiny.  There's a provision buried in there limiting the authority of the judicial branch.  Of course, MSM will just focus on Harvard and tariffs.  All part of the plan.

posts.title: Twelve injured in knife attack at Hamburg railway station
top_comments:
>This is the latest violent attack in Germany in recent months.

thats certainly a statement

*A spokesman for the Hamburg fire department told Agence France-Presse (AFP) that 12 people had been injured in the attack. Among them were "six people with life-threatening injuries," the spokesman said.*

This account makes the attack more deadly than the earlier one
Women in male dominated fields
For an incident like this to happen during rush hour it could have been much worse.
I assume interest in this will magically disappear when people find out it was a 39 y.o. woman
A bit of a morbid question but seriously how did she get *12* people before being stopped? That seems like a lot for a knife rampage

A few people in the comments failing to remember the phrase “don’t bring a knife to a gunfight”.

People hellbent on causing harm will find a way, if she had a gun there would be fatalities and probably many more lives affected.
How could the knife do this??
At least she didn't have a gun, this certainly would have been *much* worse.
[ Removed by Reddit ]

posts.title: Record beef prices raise Memorial Day cookout costs
top_comments: Nuh uh. Facebook told me prices for everything is waaaayyyy down.

> Ground chuck prices in April reached a record $6 per pound, up 14% from a year ago, after farmers slashed their cattle herds to a 74-year low due to a years-long drought that reduced grazing lands.

No, there is no climate change, let's remove all environmental protection laws. And *DRILL*!
A year ago, this would get 24-7 breathless news coverage on every cable outlet.

It baffles me that people are still acting like our economy isn't crashing. People are out here spending hundreds of dollars on groceries that they don't need for holiday parties like this. Most of my coworkers were talking about how they spent the majority of their paychecks buying real eggs for Easter this year. And they looked at me like I was batshit insane when I said it would be cheaper to just use the plastic ones and you're not wasting food by doing it too. These people live in a completely different reality than the rest of us
This is what we (as a country) get for electing an old fool with dementia to be President.
When can we expect the stupid graphics like Fox News has done for Thanksgiving?

Canned tuna fish is making a big comeback for tens of millions on fixed incomes or depressed, Republican-driven wages.   Soup!  Soup is still a decent buy if you get it on sale and buy the store brand.     
The old Memorial  Day Soup-fests of the Trump 2.0 administration.  Remember them well.  

Or, beans and weenies are a good substitute.  

We are honoring the ones Don refers to as "suckers and losers" who gave their lives so we could have the freedoms we enjoy today so easily taken away by one man.  Enjoy!

What do you mean? 

Groceries including beef are at an all time low. Everyone is saying it. We have the most beautiful prices in the world. Maybe ever. They come up to me and say "sir, thank you for the lowest prices we've ever seen".
So Fox News/MAGA/Trump will blame Biden, Obama, Hillary and maybe Kamala…in that order.

Beef quality in America has dropped SO MUCH in the last 20 years, its all garbage now, and prices climb. I saw a 4 pack of ribeyes at costco for $80 a couple weeks ago and its the same quality as Wal-Mart steak.

posts.title: At least 12 injured in hot air balloon crash near popular tourist site in Mexico
top_comments:
They are *extremely* lucky.

Pretty much every other time I've seen a power line hot air balloon story has been a no survivors moment

The hot air balloon ride we did in Turkey was the first and last I’ll ever do. Views were epic and amazing, it was also out of control the entire time, almost ran into another balloon, and we got rag dolled so hard on landing we all thought we were going to die. Super cool and exciting, but never again.
I don't think I could ever be convinced to go on a hot air balloon

>*The civil protection agency added that the balloon was operated by a tour company that offers hot air balloon rides to view the pyramids from above.*

It may not be the only hot air this tour company offers.
No way in hell you're getting me in one of those balloons. I've never thought that they were safe.
Thank God it wasn't a bus crash, there would have been 120 injured.
I once heard a comedian say “I’m not saying ALL white people die in hot air balloon accidents. I’m just saying ONLY white people die in hot air balloon accidents.”

posts.title: Delivery driver finds way onto secured areas at O'Hare, drives miles before being spotted
top_comments:
*A source told CBS News Chicago the delivery driver drove miles along the interior and restricted roads at O'Hare — potentially crossing runways — before someone spotted him from the air traffic control tower.*

Not at all surprising. Getting confused and lost inside a major metropolitan airport is almost par for the course.

"Request access to gate agent Jimmy, Doordash 322"

"Doordash, left turn on Lima, hold Tango."

"Left Lima, hold Tango. Doordash 322"

"Speaking of hold, did you hold the hot sauce as requested?"

"Hold on... the associate did add hot sauce packets just in case but confirmed none in the pax load. Doordash 322"

"Clear to deliver to Jimmy gate. Request diversion of hot sauce to control tower, Doordash. My lunch has no gust. I'll make it worth your while"

"Deliver to Jimmy and hot sauce to ATC tower. Big tip. Doordash 322"

"Safe travels"
Reminds me of a story from years ago about how some person's GPS app told them to use some back entrance that was for service vehicles. They ignored a bunch of signs and wound up on the tarmac.
Someone was watching this dude on the map going "wtf, where is he going with my pizza"
The threat of the boss was greater than the threat of guys with guns.
We all get lost at that dump. Including the planes.

posts.title: Georgia O’Connor, U.K. boxer, dies at 25 after saying doctors 'gaslit' her on cancer concerns for months
top_comments: Says she had UC and PSC. That combo makes it extremely likely this was bile duct cancer. Extremely deadly with one of the worst survival rates. Docs would 100% know the risk for her. Tragic.
No shit. It was just a couple days ago where a 'major American medical body' said to use pain management when inserting IUDs. Fuck all the medical systems.

So sad how the doctors let this girl down. None of them should be allowed to work in this field. The article doesn't seem to say what type of cancer she had but it seems like it was pretty aggressive based on the timeline and those weeks they spent spinning twiddling their thumbs and refusing to do tests probably cost this girl her life.

Very common. I was having abdominal pain for years and despite multiple CAT scans and colonoscopies and doctors telling me nothing was wrong. Eventually it got so bad and a doctor finally found out my aorta was splitting (aorta dissection) but at that point I needed emergency surgery. Still paying the helicopter bill.
Genuine question: In the UK, can you go pay for bloodwork labs? In the US, you don't need to have a doctor referral if you pay out of pocket.

This happens all the time and it’s quite sad. You can’t fully trust doctors, need to do your own research, and 100% need to advocate for yourself at all times. 

Without sharing too much information, a close family member had cancer and our doctor advocated a very relaxed approach with no surgery. We pushed back after doing research and they said no. We all got a bad feeling and got a second opinion. 

The second opinion said we should have had surgery yesterday and scheduled it ASAP. 

That surgery saved their life and they’re still here today in remission because of it.
One more reason not to go private healthcare.
How could the insurance company do this? Oh wait.
The sooner AI takes over personalized diagnostic medicine, the better.
Should have bamed the doctors and practice(s) ...

posts.title: Judge blocks Trump administration from revoking Harvard enrollment of foreign students
top_comments: Trump and his team fully expected this to happen. They know that even if it gets fully blocked by the courts, it will succeed in scaring away international students from attending Harvard. And for the ones who still decide to go, the judicial department will probably target them.

More Tumpism dystopia.  Everybody needs to ignore any order given by Trump at this point. Flat out refuse to do anything he or his funkies decree. It is the only way this ends. Well.... not the only way, but the only peaceful way.

>"unelected judges have no right to stop the Trump Administration from exercising their rightful control over immigration policy and national security policy.”

They most certainly do. It is one of the core responsibilities of the judicial branch and is enshrined in the Constitution of the United States. 

They fully know these facts but do not care and are wilfully defying their oaths of office. This is reason enough for them to be thrown out of office. But the protections in the Constitution to enforce these provisions are hopelessly toothless. Bad faith actors in the Trump administration know these facts too and do not care about the harm they are causing the nation.
Didn’t he just pass a bill enabling him to ignore and arrest judges he disagrees with? And didn't he make himself immune to crimin al proceedings? (Textbook narcissist)
Damage is done. How many foreigners want to be a tennis ball on this game?
It doesn't matter if they sue.  Trump will just ignore any judgements against him and he will do what he wants.  He said he would be a dictator on day one, and I guess he kept his word.

What keeps me going in this depressing time Is the hope that contempt findings can be had against anyone who tries to enforce an illegal action. Trump himself may be immune, but all the people working for him should face judicial wrath. Specially, civil contempt, which cannot be pardoned.

posts.title: Justice Department sues 4 New Jersey cities over immigration policies
top_comments: Testing the waters. Also notice they picked mid sized cities with undersized pocket books. Clearly they would have *preferred* to go after Chicago, SF, etc, but they would have put up a much more well resourced fight.
Project 2025 is some bad shit.

> According to the federal government's claims, "these cities (along with their elected officials) deny federal immigration agents access to illegal aliens in local custody; **restrict local officers' ability to hand over illegal aliens to federal agents; and bar otherwise willing local officers from providing mission-critical information to federal immigration authorities.**"

I want to emphasize the parts I put in bold.

Cities get to decide what they spend money on, and that includes choosing what their cops spend time on. Trump might rather they spend their money on helping ICE, but he doesn’t get to make that choice.

Here’s hoping the city attorneys can fend this off. 

Good news is that it appears that the DOJ lawyers left there are dog shit. All the good ones were either appear to have been purged or left for private practice.
So wait...didnt they run their entire election campaign on "states rights "...they lied?  Shocking /s

Oh good, just in time for it to be against the law for most of us to get vaccinated against it.

Here we go again...

So glad we have the brainworm to keep us strong and healthy.

/s
Trump and Covid, name a more iconic duo....
Maybe another pandemic is what we need to reset the timelines. It'll take us back to 2019 when the world wasn't on fire all the time

>While authorities in Hong Kong say there is no evidence that the variant, a descendant of the XDV lineage of the virus, is more severe, they have begun urging residents to mask when in public transportation or crowded places as cases have climbed.

>Health authorities in Taiwan have also reported a rise in emergency room visits, severe cases and deaths. Local health authorities say they are stockpiling vaccines and antiviral treatments in response to the epidemic wave.

posts.title: Delivery driver finds way onto secured areas at O'Hare, drives miles before being spotted
top_comments:
*A source told CBS News Chicago the delivery driver drove miles along the interior and restricted roads at O'Hare — potentially crossing runways — before someone spotted him from the air traffic control tower.*

Not at all surprising. Getting confused and lost inside a major metropolitan airport is almost par for the course.

"Request access to gate agent Jimmy, Doordash 322"

"Doordash, left turn on Lima, hold Tango."

"Left Lima, hold Tango. Doordash 322"

"Speaking of hold, did you hold the hot sauce as requested?"

"Hold on... the associate did add hot sauce packets just in case but confirmed none in the pax load. Doordash 322"

"Clear to deliver to Jimmy gate. Request diversion of hot sauce to control tower, Doordash. My lunch has no gust. I'll make it worth your while"

"Deliver to Jimmy and hot sauce to ATC tower. Big tip. Doordash 322"

"Safe travels"
Reminds me of a story from years ago about how some person's GPS app told them to use some back entrance that was for service vehicles. They ignored a bunch of signs and wound up on the tarmac.
Someone was watching this dude on the map going "wtf, where is he going with my pizza"
The threat of the boss was greater than the threat of guys with guns.
We all get lost at that dump. Including the planes.

posts.title: Record beef prices raise Memorial Day cookout costs

No, there is no climate change, let's remove all environmental protection laws. And *DRILL*!
A year ago, this would get 24-7 breathless news coverage on every cable outlet.

It baffles me that people are still acting like our economy isn't crashing. People are out here spending hundreds of dollars on groceries that they don't need for holiday parties like this. Most of my coworkers were talking about how they spent the majority of their paychecks buying real eggs for Easter this year. And they looked at me like I was batshit insane when I said it would be cheaper to just use the plastic ones and you're not wasting food by doing it too. These people live in a completely different reality than the rest of us

Canned tuna fish is making a big comeback for tens of millions on fixed incomes or depressed, Republican-driven wages.   Soup!  Soup is still a decent buy if you get it on sale and buy the store brand.     
The old Memorial  Day Soup-fests of the Trump 2.0 administration.  Remember them well.  

Or, beans and weenies are a good substitute.  

We are honoring the ones Don refers to as "suckers and losers" who gave their lives so we could have the freedoms we enjoy today so easily taken away by one man.  Enjoy!

Groceries including beef are at an all time low. Everyone is saying it. We have the most beautiful prices in the world. Maybe ever. They come up to me and say "sir, thank you for the lowest prices we've ever seen".

posts.title: Georgia O’Connor, U.K. boxer, dies at 25 after saying doctors 'gaslit' her on cancer concerns for months
top_comments: Says she had UC and PSC. That combo makes it extremely likely this was bile duct cancer. Extremely deadly with one of the worst survival rates. Docs would 100% know the risk for her. Tragic.
No shit. It was just a couple days ago where a 'major American medical body' said to use pain management when inserting IUDs. Fuck all the medical systems.

So sad how the doctors let this girl down. None of them should be allowed to work in this field. The article doesn't seem to say what type of cancer she had but it seems like it was pretty aggressive based on the timeline and those weeks they spent spinning twiddling their thumbs and refusing to do tests probably cost this girl her life.

Very common. I was having abdominal pain for years and despite multiple CAT scans and colonoscopies and doctors telling me nothing was wrong. Eventually it got so bad and a doctor finally found out my aorta was splitting (aorta dissection) but at that point I needed emergency surgery. Still paying the helicopter bill.
Genuine question: In the UK, can you go pay for bloodwork labs? In the US, you don't need to have a doctor referral if you pay out of pocket.

This happens all the time and it’s quite sad. You can’t fully trust doctors, need to do your own research, and 100% need to advocate for yourself at all times. 

Without sharing too much information, a close family member had cancer and our doctor advocated a very relaxed approach with no surgery. We pushed back after doing research and they said no. We all got a bad feeling and got a second opinion. 

The second opinion said we should have had surgery yesterday and scheduled it ASAP. 

That surgery saved their life and they’re still here today in remission because of it.
One more reason not to go private healthcare.
How could the insurance company do this? Oh wait.
The sooner AI takes over personalized diagnostic medicine, the better.
Should have bamed the doctors and practice(s) ...

posts.title: Justice Department sues 4 New Jersey cities over immigration policies
top_comments: Testing the waters. Also notice they picked mid sized cities with undersized pocket books. Clearly they would have *preferred* to go after Chicago, SF, etc, but they would have put up a much more well resourced fight.
Project 2025 is some bad shit.

> According to the federal government's claims, "these cities (along with their elected officials) deny federal immigration agents access to illegal aliens in local custody; **restrict local officers' ability to hand over illegal aliens to federal agents; and bar otherwise willing local officers from providing mission-critical information to federal immigration authorities.**"

I want to emphasize the parts I put in bold.

Cities get to decide what they spend money on, and that includes choosing what their cops spend time on. Trump might rather they spend their money on helping ICE, but he doesn’t get to make that choice.

Here’s hoping the city attorneys can fend this off. 

Good news is that it appears that the DOJ lawyers left there are dog shit. All the good ones were either appear to have been purged or left for private practice.
So wait...didnt they run their entire election campaign on "states rights "...they lied?  Shocking /s
